newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani rupee ends down in kerb, seen weak.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani rupee ends down in kerb, seen weak.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee ended 0.01 down at 41.33 to the dollar in the kerb market on Monday amid a high demand for the U.S. currency and would slip further soon, dealers said.
"The demand for the dollar outpaced its supply today," one dealer said. "The dollar has gained against most major world currencies and the trend will also reflect here."

The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, changed on July 11, was 40.5200/40.7226 rupees against the dollar. The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates ended steady at 2.20 percent. -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192
